{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question asks about the adult stage of filarial worms responsible for diseases in all except one. After reviewing the relevant documents, I found that Onchocerca volvulus is the worm that causes river blindness in humans and is not primarily responsible for diseases in animals. The other options (Brugia malayi, Mansonella ozzardi, and Wuchereria bancrofti) are all known to cause filarial diseases in animals or humans.", "answer_choice": "B"}
